title.narrative: Joining our Hopes: Building Sustainable Alternatives on the Southern Border, Chiapas

description.narrative: The project is located in the far southeastern region of the country in the state of Chiapas. The main problems in this region are continual emigration, dependence on external production, diminishing production for local consumption, paternalistic relationships, segregation of society and the loss of local knowledge and ancestral practices. In an effort to improve their lives, 60 families in 12 communities in the municipalities of La Trinitaria and La Independencia will benefit from the placement of 1,200 birds, 600 rabbits, 120 pigs, 100 sheep, 1,200 fruit trees and 20 pounds of vegetable seeds. The project will not use any materials associated with conventional animal or plant care like chicken wire, but animals and plants will be cared for through traditional forms of management using materials native to the region such as wood and stone. These practices are meant to avoid the use of highly contaminating steel and cement industries that are contrary to sustainable development. The goals are the social extension to an additional 11 neighboring communities to strengthen the social processes. Local farmers will share their knowledge, which will result in the recovery of sustainable food sources and efforts to build regional coordination. These, in turn, will facilitate common community needs and serve as an alternative space for other disadvantaged communities in the region lacking organizational structure. The project will also benefit another 120 families by Passing on the Gift.
